verses.verse: Yes, (Is. 64:5) in the way of Your judgments, O LORD, we have (Is. 25:9; 33:2) waited for You; The desire of our soul is for Your name And for the remembrance of You.

(Ps. 63:6; Song 3:1; Is. 50:10; Luke 6:12) With my soul I have desired You in the night, Yes, by my spirit within me I will seek You early; For when Your judgments are in the earth, The inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

(Eccl. 8:12; (Rom. 2:4)) Let grace be shown to the wicked, Yet he will not learn righteousness; In (Ps. 143:10) the land of uprightness he will deal unjustly, And will not behold the majesty of the LORD.
LORD, when Your hand is lifted up, (Job 34:27; Ps. 28:5; Is. 5:12) they will not see. But they will see and be ashamed For their envy of people; Yes, the fire of Your enemies shall devour them.
LORD, You will establish peace for us, For You have also done all our works in us.
O LORD our God, (2 Chr. 12:8) masters besides You Have had dominion over us; But by You only we make mention of Your name.
They are dead, they will not live; They are deceased, they will not rise. Therefore You have punished and destroyed them, And made all their memory to (Eccl. 9:5; Is. 14:22) perish.
You have increased the nation, O LORD, You have (Is. 9:3) increased the nation; You are glorified; You have expanded all the borders of the land.
LORD, (Is. 37:3; Hos. 5:15) in trouble they have visited You, They poured out a prayer when Your chastening was upon them.
As (Is. 13:8; (John 16:21)) a woman with child Is in pain and cries out in her pangs, When she draws near the time of her delivery, So have we been in Your sight, O LORD.

We have been with child, we have been in pain; We have, as it were, brought forth wind; We have not accomplished any deliverance in the earth, Nor have (Ps. 17:14) the inhabitants of the world fallen.

(Is. 25:8; (Ezek. 37:1-14)) Your dead shall live; Together with my dead body they shall arise. ((Dan. 12:2); Hos. 13:14) Awake and sing, you who dwell in dust; For your dew is like the dew of herbs, And the earth shall cast out the dead.

(Take Refuge from the Coming Judgment) Come, my people, (Ex. 12:22, 23; (Ps. 91:1, 4)) enter your chambers, And shut your doors behind you; Hide yourself, as it were, ((Ps. 30:5; Is. 54:7, 8; 2 Cor. 4:17)) for a little moment, Until the indignation is past.
